title: How to Install and Uninstall Applications from Terminal in Ubuntu

steps.title: To open the Terminal, press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard or go to Applications > Accessories > Terminal.
steps.content: To open the Terminal, press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard or go to Applications > Accessories > Terminal. For example, to install your desired software on Ubuntu, you're need to use command: sudo apt-get install ’application_name’ (Replace ’application name’ with the application you want to install)

steps.title: To install MPlayer, you need to type following command to the Terminal (press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard) or use copy/paste method:
steps.content: To install MPlayer, you need to type following command to the Terminal (press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard) or use copy/paste method: sudo apt-get install mplayer (then hit Enter)

steps.title: When it asks you for password, don't be confused.
steps.content: When it asks you for password, don't be confused. The password is that one, which you're using in the Login Screen. Password does not show up in the terminal when you type it. Just type your password and hit Enter. If your password was entered correctly, the action will continue.

steps.title: When it asks you do you want to continue, type ’y’ (then hit Enter)
steps.content: When it asks you do you want to continue, type ’y’ (then hit Enter)

steps.title: Wait for installation to be completed.
steps.content: Wait for installation to be completed. After that, if you want to run MPlayer, you need to type following command to the Terminal: mplayer (then hit Enter)

steps.title: To uninstall MPlayer, you need to type following command to the Terminal (press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard) or use copy/paste method:
steps.content: To uninstall MPlayer, you need to type following command to the Terminal (press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard) or use copy/paste method: sudo apt-get remove mplayer (then hit Enter)

steps.title: When it asks you for password, don't be confused.
steps.content: When it asks you for password, don't be confused. The password is that one, which you're using in the Login Screen. Password does not show up in the terminal when you type it. Just type your password and hit Enter. If your password was entered correctly, the action will continue.

steps.title: When it asks you do you want to continue, type ’y’ (then hit Enter)
steps.content: When it asks you do you want to continue, type ’y’ (then hit Enter)

steps.title: Wait for uninstallation to be completed.
steps.content: Wait for uninstallation to be completed. After that, close your Terminal. That's all.
